title: Synthetic Recap
body:
HOUSTON (AP) – On a night when legends were meant to shine, Hakeem Olajuwon authored a masterpiece. The Houston Rockets’ big man was simply unstoppable, pouring in a historic 47 points to carry his team to a 112-103 victory over the Minnesota Timberwolves.

From the opening tip, it was clear this was Olajuwon’s stage. He dominated the paint with an array of his signature Dream Shakes, fallaway jumpers, and powerful post moves, leaving the Timberwolves’ defense scrambling for answers all night. His 47-point explosion was a testament to his singular focus and offensive genius, single-handedly outscoring entire stretches of the game for the visitors.

While Olajuwon’s scoring was the main event, he was far from a one-man show. Clyde Drexler provided the perfect counterpoint, orchestrating the offense with a game-high 13 assists and chipping in 15 points of his own. The duo’s chemistry was on full display, with Drexler repeatedly feeding the hot hand of Olajuwon in perfect rhythm.

Minnesota, to their credit, fought valiantly. Kevin Garnett posted a strong 19-point, 8-rebound line and Stephon Marbury facilitated with 11 assists, but they simply had no answer for the force of nature wearing Rockets red. Every Wolves run was met with a decisive bucket from Olajuwon, silencing any hope of a comeback.

In the end, the stat sheet told the story of one man’s transcendent performance. Forty-seven points. It was a number that echoed through the Summit, a reminder of Hakeem Olajuwon’s greatness and a night the Timberwolves, and all who witnessed it, would not soon forget.
